pr_title: Bring latest from master to preview

timeline.message:
release(2020-02-11): bump package versions (#705)

Co-authored-by: az-iot-builder-01 <az-iot-builder-01@users.noreply.github.com>

refactor(misc): Remove unused versions.json file

It was a relic of our old release process
fix(sample): Fix reconnection sample to retry open for retry-able exceptions
fix(samples): Throw the non-retryable exception caught while opening connection
refactor(samples): Refactor to wait before retrying open
refactor(samples): Return thread sleep InterruptedException as a RuntimeException
fix(samples): Fix NPR in DeviceClientManager on null status callback
fix(iot-device): Mark AmqpSessionErrantLinkException as retryable and AmqpLinkMessageSizeExceededException as non-retryable
doc(reconnection-sample): Added a document specifying the current SDK retry filter for exceptions
refactor(doc): Update spacing in transport exception readme

fix(iot-device): Allow mqtt_ws http proxy to work over http 1.0

Sending a connect request with http/1.1 to a server may result in server responded with http/1.0 response. SDK used to require http/1.1 response, but there is no practical difference to the SDK whether we get 1.0 or 1.1, so the SDK should ignore this response version

refactor(deps, iot-service): Refactor amqp service client implementation (#713)

-Add substantial logging to service client operations over amqp including happy path and error path
-Abstract some common amqp logic from each of file upload notification receiver, feedback message receiver, and cloud to device sender

Avoid pulling in Java 9 via slf4j (#718)

1.2.1 depends on slf4j 1.8 beta which includes java9 modules

Co-authored-by: timtay-microsoft <timtay@microsoft.com>

fix(vsts): Make pom.xml changes and vsts pipeline changes count as package changes (#721)

changes to deps pom.xml should force run of iothub and provisioning, for instance
Bump package versions for release on 2020-02-20
(security:x509-provider): Upgrade the version of bouncy castle dependency (#723)
refactor(iot-dev): Upgrade azure storage SDK dependency version

doc(all): Update versions for Maven dependencies in devbox setup(#725)

Co-authored-by: timtay-microsoft <timtay@microsoft.com>

Add support for JobProperties.StorageAuthenticationType property (#717)

Adding support of Identity for Storage

release(2020-03-13): bump package versions (#731)

Bump package versions for release on 2020-03-13

refactor(gate): Change agent pool for SDL

this new pool uses a vm in Azure

fix(iot-device): Fix incorrect logging in AMQP session manager (#730)

Co-authored-by: timtay-microsoft <timtay@microsoft.com>

doc: fix Device class documentation (#736)

Co-authored-by: timtay-microsoft <timtay@microsoft.com>

Improve API documentation (#735)

Improve documentation for new APIs

feat(iot-dev): Add support for CA signed X509 over MQTT_WS, and HTTPS (#727)

HTTP required no code changes because it already worked, strangely. Mqtt only needed to stop sending the query string "?iothub-no-client-cert=true" when connecting. This didn't use to work, but something from service side seems to have changed

Do not accept HTTP urls in Https connection constructor (#733)

* Do not accept HTTP urls in Https connection constructor

* Fix the unit test to catch the correct exception

* Rename the test to better represent the actual expectation

Co-authored-by: timtay-microsoft <timtay@microsoft.com>

fix(vsts): Fix smart gate not recognizing changes to e2e helper code (#741)

The common code did not follow the path "iot-e2e-tests/common/helpers" but rather "iot-e2e-tests/common/src/..."

refactor(e2e): Change e2e test cert generation encryption algorithms (#740)

SHA256 + RSA-4096 rather than SHA1 + RSA-1024

fix(iot-device): Fix issue where SDK didn't validate application properties correctly (#743)

Normally the SDK wouldn't validate something like this, but if a user tries to send an application property with an invalid character in it, the different protocols behave differently in unintuitive ways. MQTT will sever the connection with no error message while AMQPS and HTTPS will allow it.

fix(sample): Fix android sample not working with file upload (#744)

The Azure storage service has separate SDKs for Android and regular Java, so this sample needs to use the Android storage SDK and exclude the default storage SDK.

Similarly, SLF4J also has an Android specific dependency that we should use here instead

fix(e2e):Upgrade guava package to avoid vulnerability by explicitly s… (#745)

* fix(e2e):Upgrade guava package to avoid vulnerability by explicitly specifying the version

Co-authored-by: timtay-microsoft <timtay@microsoft.com>

refactor(prov-dev, deps): Add better logging to provisioning device client (#746)

Also fixing an issue where provisioning device client didn't propagate up the error code if an http exception was returned from service

Also fixing a bug where if the provisioning device client ignored amqp messages getting rejected from service. Now the sdk responds and throws appropriately
release(2020-03-30): bump package versions

fix(e2e): Upgrade swagger-parser to 1.0.50 (#750)

* (fix) Fix for 4167374: Known code execution vulnerability in Swagger parser

* fix(e2e): Re-add a depedency that was removed by mistake

fix(iot-device):Introduce a new option for receive interval (#752)

* fix(iot-device):Introduce a new option for receive message interval for MQTT and AMQP protocols
feat(iot-dev): Add setOption API for setting https request read and connect timeouts
release(2020-04-14): bump package versions

doc(all): Fix java devbox setup instructions

We don't have the shade plugin anymore, so this set of instructions shouldn't suggest that the compiled jars contain all dependencies
doc(iot): Add doc to explain how to use the SDK's logging (#760)
fix(docs): Add the team as the owners to the code base (#761)

fix(iot-dev): Fix issue with setOption for setting https settings

Worked for module clients, but not for device clients
release(2020-04-22): bump package versions
fix(docs): Fix typo in codeowners doc

fix(iot-dev): Fix bug in amqpws, raise max message size from 1 kb to 16 kb (#767)

Max IoT Hub messsage size is 256 kb, so this is still a bug that you can only send 16 kb, but this is a good incremental change that will benefit customers
feat(iot-service): Add proxy support for registry manager (#768)

feat(iot-service): Add proxy support for service client operations (#773)

refactor the way the registry manager consumes the proxy option as well, in case we need to add authentication support later as well. The proxyOptions object will allow us to add username and password if necessary

fix(iot-dev): Fix issue where MQTT didn't url encode application properties correctly (#775)

URLEncoder.Encode fails to encode the character ' ' in an MQTT friendly way, so I've added a manual replace step for this character.

Also removing all character validation for application property keys and values now that this MQTT bug is fixed. There is no longer a device-side reason to validate these values as all protocols are encoding them correctly now such that the protocol doesn't throw an exception. Iot Hub will be the validator, not the client
feat(device;service): Support Twin Array properties (#770)
fix(iot-dev): Fix issue where amqp layer didn't recognize an ack to a subscription message that it sent (#778)
release(2020-05-15): bump package versions
doc(iot-dev): Add missing javadoc explaining SetSendInterval for setOption API (#781)
doc(iot-dev, iot-service): Add clarification to startDeviceTwin() API docs (#776)

Add support for fully qualified error codes in service client HTTP exceptions (#782)

* fix(iot-service): Fix small logging mistake in amqp sender

previously, this log would claim that the message was delivered regardless of what the remote state was.

* feat(iot-serv, deps): Add support for substatus codes to http exceptions
fix(iot-device): Fix issue where creationTimeUTC used local timezone during stringification (#784)

refactor(iot-service): Make all service operations use the latest service api version (#788)

This API version was only available in certain regions previously, but now that it is available in every region, we can make all service client operations use this
resolving conflicts
adding preview api version and enabling tests

timeline.bodyText: hey now, I've tried to avoid any java exposure :p
timeline.author: drwill-ms
